dish_description: The dish is a dessert for two, featuring a pear with a layer of puff pastry on top, seasoned with sugar, melted butter, and apricot or peach sauce, then baked until warm and crispy.

cooking_steps.description: Peel a large pear, especially if it's slightly damaged, to prepare it for the dessert.
Place the peeled pear on a dish and add a layer of puff pastry on top.
Sprinkle a bit of sugar over the pear.
Apply a little melted butter over the pear and puff pastry.
Add a dash of apricot or peach sauce around the pear, and possibly a little bit of water to create a sauce.
Cover the pear and sauce with a piece of puff pastry, trimming any freezer-burned edges if necessary.
Brush the puff pastry with a bit more butter and sprinkle approximately 1 to 2 teaspoons of sugar on top.
Bake the dessert in a preheated 400-degree oven for about 30 to 35 minutes until the pastry is crispy and golden. Serve the dessert lukewarm.
